Articles.Content:
<p>Go<br/></p><figure class="tmblr-full" data-orig-height="68" data-orig-width="480"><img data-orig-height="68" data-orig-width="480" src="http://36.media.tumblr.com/029295276005d87285b9343b52aa5b9c/tumblr_inline_nxmhwadVhm1rr2wit_540.png"/></figure><p>Hello everyone!<br/><br/>

As announced in the devnotes today we have published a Ã¢â‚¬ËœsilentÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ patch for

1.0.5. This quick patch brings a few fixes to issues that popped up in

the update:<br/></p><blockquote><p>- Reduced engine heating: less explosive decoupling. .<br/>

- Fixed NRE on Kerbal when the part it’s on dies. .<br/>

- Fixed IVA breaking on crew transfer. <br/>

- Fixed typo on Dynawing craft. <br/>

- IntakeAir resource is now fully hidden in Resources App. .<br/>

- Fixed body lift (it now exists again). .<br/>

- Fixed every instance of part name, so root parts can be detected in all contractual instances. .<br/>

- Used Unity drag to avoid integration errors on splashdown. <br/>

- Clamped parachute radiation. .<br/>

- Upgrade outdated instances of vessel situations in career saves.<br/> - Included layer 19 objects in potential enclosing colliders for cargo bays.<br/></p></blockquote><p><i>Steam </i>users will not have to do anything to have this patch applied to

their game, those of you who have downloaded it through the <i>KSP Store</i>

can redownload the game, and finally if you’ve bought the game through <i>

GOG </i>the patch is currently in their approval process, we’ll update our forum

thread once it’s available. The <b><a href="http://i.imgur.com/RqnW84F.png">build number</a></b> in the main menu will jump from 1024 to 1028 after the patch is applied.<br/><br/>

The update is now available for download.<br/></p>
